org.easylibs.options

Interface Options

  • All Superinterfaces:
    OptionGroup

    public interface Options
extends OptionGroup
    Options manager. Options manager is used to manage different types of options which are then used with Args parser to perform matches between the options in manager's cache and command line arguments.

    To build an option manager and register options with it, you must use the Options.Builder object and call the Options.Builder.build() method to build get an instance.

    The Options class also provides some prebuilt factory static methods such as of(java.util.Collection<org.easylibs.options.Option<?>>), fromBeans(java.lang.Class<?>) and fromProperties(java.util.Properties) for the most common types of builds. However note, that these simply invoke the builder and you are able to build yourself a complex set of option arrangements.

    Alternatively some concrete implementations of Arg parsers also provide factory methods to perform an option manager build and parsing in a single step. Static factory methods in the form of() and ofOptional found in Args are used to build options and parse arguments in a single step.

    For example Args and Args parsers will build Options and parse the command line in one step.

    Examples

    Options built from class fields as beans 

     public class MyClass {
   @Arg
   static int optionA;
 }
 Options options = Options.fromBeans(MyClass.class);

    or options build from java properties 

     Properties properties = new Properties();
 properties.setProperty("optionA", "");
 Options options = Options.fromProperties(MyClass.class);

    Lastly simple options which you have to query manually 

     Options options = new Options.Builder()
        .named("optionA", int.class)
        .build();
 
 Option<Integer> optionA = options.get("optionA", int.class);
 
 Args args = Args.of(argv, options);
 System.out.println(optionA.toString());
